name: SMTP King Pro
author: Ash Durham

sections.description:
—

Stay up-to-date with the latest by following @kingproplugins on Twitter, KingProPlugins on Facebook or King Pro Plugins on Google+

—

SMTP King Pro seamlessly enables you to use your own email address to send out emails from your WordPress site. This will make these
emails appear as if they are being sent directly from you by using your email address in the from field as opposed to WordPress using the servers generic email address
to send the emails out. Just install and set, SMTP King Pro handles the rest.

SMTP King Pro allows you to specify your SMTP host, the username and password to connect to your email, the SMTP port if different
from default and what address and name to use as the “from” address.

—

If you have any suggestions or would like to see a feature in the plugin, please let me know in the support forum.

Any issues you are having, I’d also love to know, so again, please let me know using the support forum.

—

Check out the King Pro Plugins range
sections.installation:
1. Download and unzip the zip file onto your computer
  2. Upload the ‘smtp-king-pro’ folder into the /wp-content/plugins/ directory (alternatively, install the plugin from the plugin directory within the admin)
  3. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  4. Drag the widget into your sidebar and modify the settings or insert the shortcode into a post or theme template.

—

Having Trouble? Get support either on the support forums here or at @kingproplugins on Twitter, KingProPlugins on Facebook or King Pro Plugins on Google+

—
sections.faq:
How do I find my SMTP details?

These details are normally provided by your mail server host. Standard settings are generally mail.yourdomain.com and using your email as a username and your emails password.

—

Have a question thats not listed? Get support either on the support forums here or at @kingproplugins on Twitter, KingProPlugins on Facebook or King Pro Plugins on Google+

—

  • Updated to allow TLS and SSL connections to be used

  • Update to KPP section with release of new plugin
  • Created local copy of Font Awesome as requested by WordPress

1.0

  • Initial

short_description: Overrides the standard wp_mail function and used SwiftMail via an SMTP connection to send you site mail
